Project Approvals:POWERGRID's 'Committee of Directors on Investment on Projects' approved investment for three major projects on May 1, 2025.

Transmission System Strengthening for Bhadla/Bikaner Complex:This project, estimated to cost ₹212.81 crore, is aimed at facilitating the evacuation of power, particularly renewable energy, from the Bhadla/Bikaner complex. The commissioning is scheduled for within 18 months, by June 9, 2026.

Eastern Region Expansion Scheme-43 (ERES-43):This project, with an estimated cost of ₹342.69 crore, will enhance transmission infrastructure in Eastern India. It is targeted for completion within 18 months, with a best-effort target of 15 months, by March 1, 2026.

Eastern Region Expansion Scheme-44 (ERES-44):This project, also aimed at improving transmission capacity in the eastern region, has an estimated cost of ₹408.94 crore. It is scheduled for completion within 18 months, with a best-effort target of 15 months, by May 24, 2026.

Financial Details:Although not directly announced on May 1, it's worth noting that the company's consolidated net profit marginally declined in Q4 FY25 (ending March 31, 2025) to ₹4,142.87 crore,according to Business Standard. For the entire FY25, the consolidated net profit also saw a marginal dip to ₹15,521.44 crore. The Board recommended a final dividend of ₹1.25 per equity share for FY25.
